utterance.speaker: STACEY
utterance.content: Wait, we didn’t approve this poster.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: No, Sid Ross did. What Sid wants Sid gets. He doesn’t care what the network thinks.

utterance.speaker: STACEY
utterance.content: Then what’s the point of discussing cast changes with him? He’s just going to do what he wants regardless.

utterance.speaker: PATRICK
utterance.content: As always.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA RODGERS
utterance.content: Is he dead? Is he dead? Is he dead? Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, good morning, Martha.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is who dead?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No, I’m just – Is he dead? Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle. Something’s wrong with your mother.

utterance.speaker: RICHARD CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re just realizing this now?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. Shh. Listen.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh. She’s doing 48-hour first line. Oh, that’s right. You haven’t lived here while Mother is preparing to open in a play. This, believe it or not, is her little ritual for getting into character.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so this is normal?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s an actor. What’s normal? I call it 48-hour first line because for the two days prior to opening night she will say nothing but her character’s first line of the play.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. That’s unique.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But doesn’t her play open next month?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s right. It’s previews that are two days away. Well now, that is odd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, Castle, there’s been a homicide.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, unfortunately Martha, he –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. Never mind.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Be honest. When you vowed for better or for worse, you really had no idea what you were agreeing to, did you?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead? Is he dead? Is he dead? Is he dead? Is –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye, Mother.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We can stay at a hotel. That way you don’t have to listen to her say that line over and over again.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, it’s okay. I mean, we’re going to manage. It’s just … your mom’s kind of –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Annoying? Yeah, I know. Trust me. We’re getting off easy. One time her opening line was “Come on, baby, I’ll make it worth your while”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ooh, I see what you mean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Most awkward parent teacher conference ever.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Lanie.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Good morning, you two. This is –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sid Ross!

utterance.speaker: BECKET
utterance.content: The creator of Saturday Night Tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, not to mention all the movies he produced. The man’s a mogul.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what happened?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: He was strangled with his own tie and then thrown down that elevator shaft from the SNT studios on the seventh floor. His body was on the roof of that elevator for hours before the panel gave way and Sid popped out.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like some jack-in-the-box from hell.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Time of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Based on lividity, between 11PM and 2AM.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Sid was burning the midnight oil.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s check with security, see if they know if anyone else was in the building with him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Considering where we are, maybe one of Sid’s employees killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Ryan and Esposito are bringing his wife in now. Maybe she knows who would have done this to him.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: Sounds like he had enemies.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anyone at the Saturday Night Tonight studio?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, was he having trouble with any of his employees there?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And that’s unusual?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And idea who that someone might be?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Was there anyone else who might know what Sid was involved in?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Mr. Vogel is right over here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chad – it’s Chad, right?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are these cast photos from all thirty five seasons of the show?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Yep. Every performer who has ever been on SNT.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, I love him. He played Fluffy the Space Puppy. That was my favorite.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the majority of this nation's comedy was born in the mind of these geniuses. Except for this season. Those guys suck.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, they were terrible.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, this guy! Ned what’s-his-name. Played uh, Doctor Finger. “I’m sorry, sir. It’s necessary I probe you.” How can you not like Doctor Finger?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because, Castle, I wasn’t a thirteen year old boy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: That’s Mr. Vogel. He’s the president of Mr. Ross’s production company.

utterance.speaker: GENE VOGEL
utterance.content: Gather around, please. Thank you, everybody. As tragic as Sid’s death is, the network has asked us to go on with tomorrow night’s show. As a tribute. Would you care to say a few words?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Check it out. That’s –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Danny Valentine!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Danny Valentine!

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: He’s our guest host this week.

utterance.speaker: DANNY VALENTINE
utterance.content: I remember when Sid asked me to host the pilot of this crazy show. Everybody said “turn him down, show’s a dud”. Well, thirty five years later it’s still going strong. We honor Sid by honoring his creation, so … let’s put on a show.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Vogel? Excuse me, I’m –

utterance.speaker: LIZ BELL
utterance.content: Detective Kate Beckett! And you’re Richard Castle. Hi, I’m Liz Bell, I’m the head writer for SNT and I absolutely adore you. And you, especially you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wha – me? Really?

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: Oh, of course. I followed your career. I wanted to be a cop, but I ended up a writer. I know, it’s pathetic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: So I’ve seen footage of you at crime scenes and I have to ask: how do you fight crime and keep your hair like that? And do it in high heels?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Detective, I assume you’re here about Sid’s death. How can I help?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, uh, we checked with security and I understand that most employees enter and exit through the front door but apparently there’s also a private VIP entrance?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: That’s right. Sid had it installed for the actors so they could come and go with more privacy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are there any security cameras on that private entrance?

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: They’re actors, so they also use it to do other things, like –

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Sid opted not to have surveillance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So there’s no way of telling who came in or out of the private entrance?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: I’m afraid not.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Was anyone working here last night between 11PM and 2AM?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Yes. All the writers and actors. Thursdays is rewrite night so most of them were here until sunup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Of those people, did anyone have a problem with Sid?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: TINA TAMINO
utterance.content: Morning, sir. We’re not quite open yet.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: I record all our rehearsals. This took place yesterday evening.

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Dude, why are you wearing armor?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY FRANKS
utterance.content: Because the sketch sucks and I’m trying to save it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mickey Franks is hilarious.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Yes, well. Just watch.

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Mickey, you can’t do this. Sid already approved the sketch.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: You know, screw Sid. Screw Sid! You want to know what I think of Sid? Here’s what I think of Sid. Sid’s dead, that’s what he is! He’s dead to me. I’ll kill him. He’s dead! He’s dead! He’s dead! He’s dead! He’s –

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Over the season Mickey’s become more and more … unstable. Mood swings, outbursts. He talks to himself. And to people that aren’t there.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: But that was the first time he ever went this far.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, did he have a reason to be angry with Sid?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Aside from the lame sketch?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Actually, yes. I talked to Sid yesterday morning. He said he was planning to fire Mickey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How could he fire his star?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: I – he’s volatile. Unpredictable. He’s become more and more of a liability.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Vogel, did Sid break the news to Mickey last night?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: I don’t know. But he might have.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, Mickey wasn’t at the gathering for Sid. Is he in the building?

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: If he is he’d be in the wardrobe and props room. He hangs out there to develop new characters.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hello? Anybody there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m really hoping Mickey’s not the one behind this. I mean, the man is just so damn funny on the show. Even the crappy episodes. Guy’s hysterical.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And quite possibly suffering a psychotic break.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yes, the fine line between genius and madness.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mickey Franks? Is that you?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: I’m sorry, you must have mistaken me for another suit of armor. Now, if you’ll excuse me –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: You’ll never take me alive!

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Ow, my pancreas.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You see what I’m saying? Even arrested he’s hilarious. Mr. Franks, you’re a comedic genius. I’m a huge fan.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Franks –

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Please direct all your questions to my personal attorney. Mickey! Don’t say another word. I am lead council for Mr. Franks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Franks, you made some threats against Sid Ross last night.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: You’re damn right – – Don’t answer that! Detective, address your questions to me, please. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, where were y – – where was your client between 11PM and 2AM last night?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: He was minding his own damn business. My client is an upstanding citizen and a pillar of the community, not to mention he’s one funny mother fudgesicle. Hey, watch your language.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What happened, Mickey? Did Sid tell you you were fired so you snapped and killed him?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Hold on, what? Sid – Sid’s dead?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Whoa! Hey! Oh, whoa, whoa. I – I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I noticed you’re no longer seeking counsel from your attorney.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: No, uh … no, that’s uh – that’s just an act. I mean, I’m not crazy. Just spent a year of my life convincing people I was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and you’ve done a pretty good job of it.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: I’m an actor, okay. I am an actor that’s tied to a long term contract that’s uh … not exactly covering his expenses.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you saying you were trying to get fired?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: I’m saying, Sid controlled my career. Because of him I’m missing out on major movie roles. That’s why I attacked you guys. I figured if you 51-50’ed me on a Bellevue psych hold he’d finally cut me loose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, look, crazy or not, you still made some pretty serious threats against Sid and hours later he ended up dead.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Okay, you’re asking my whereabouts, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Okay, I was upstairs at the rooftop bar getting wasted all night. Then I stumbled down to the wardrobe and props room about 3AM and passed out. I had just woken up when you guys came in. Plus I had no idea Sid was even dead so how could I have had anything to do with it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Look, I might know who did!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. We’re listening.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Look, at around 9PM last night I – did go to Sid’s office. To beg to be let out of my contract. But I never went in because I heard him on the phone. He was yelling at someone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who was he yelling at?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: I don’t know. But it had something to do with a deal that was going down around midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Midnight? Did he say what the deal was?

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: No. But Sid told that person on the phone they better stick to the agreement or else.

utterance.speaker: MICKEY
utterance.content: Can I call my real attorney?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The bartender confirmed Mickey’s alibi. He is not our killer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well then, we can assume Mickey was telling the truth about the phone call he overheard Sid making.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what kind of deal would Sid be making at midnight?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Whatever it was, it went down in the middle of his time of death window.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So this deal could be connected to his death. We need to figure out who Sid was talking on the phone with.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, that’s easier said than done. I just got Sid’s phone dump. At 9PM a phone call came from an untraceable burner phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? Why don’t we get a hold of Sid’s associates, see if any of them know what this deal was.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I know exactly who to start with. Right after that mystery call, Sid phoned none other than Danny Valentine. If anyone knows about that deal, it’s Valentine.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Detective, I have no idea what you’re talking about.

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Look, buddy. I’m a cop and a model so I know when someone’s lying to me. And when their outfit is clashing. Now stand back! This could be dangerous.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Don’t worry, my experience writing crime novels has prepared me for danger. Plus, I have my vest.

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Look out, bad guys! Here we come!

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Oh. Oh, model cop down. I broke a heel.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: And scene! Great job, guys.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, well, I don’t know whether we should be flattered or offended.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who cares? Danny Valentine’s playing me!

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: Well? What do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um, about the sketch? It’s … uh, cute.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Danny Valentine’s playing me.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of Mr. Valentine, we need to talk to him.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: Oh. Uh, Danny?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Ah ha. The real police. Here to give us some pointers?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Valentine, Richard Castle. I’m a big fan of you –

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Yeah. What about you, Detective? Are you a fan?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Valentine. We need to talk.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Sure. Let’s go to my dressing room.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Surely you’ve seen some of my work. Starfleet? Family Practice? My uh, my car rental commercials?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, yeah well, I – I did catch my fair share of Hot Suspect reruns in college.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: I knew it! The cop watched the cop show. Come on, I inspired you to become a detective, didn’t I? Huh?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: May – maybe a little bit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re investigating a murder. Right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Right. Yeah. Uh, so we checked Sid’s phone records and apparently he called you at 9:03 last night. Can you tell us why?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Yeah, I was supposed to have drinks with Sid and his ex, Evelyn. But Sid called last minute to cancel.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You and Sid were going out with his ex-wife? Isn’t that a bit odd?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Not for us. Sid and Evelyn split twenty years ago but we were all still close friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he say why he was canceling?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: ‘Fraid not.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Anything about a deal at midnight?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: No, but he was going somewhere because while we were on the phone I literally bumped into him leaving the building from the private entrance.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait, Sid was leaving the building the night of his murder?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, Mr. Valentine, did he mention meeting with someone?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Please. Call me Danny. And no, Sid didn’t say where he was going. But I did see something strange. He went into the subway on the corner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And why was that strange, Danny?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Well, he had an around-the-clock driver. Why would he take mass transit? Unless it was a secret rendezvous.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, wherever Sid went he obviously didn’t want anyone to know about it. Oh, come on, Castle. He was flirting with me. I can’t control that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But you were flirting back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but what was I supposed to do? He’s Danny frickin’ Valentine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Espo. Hey. You find you where Sid went on that subway ride?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not yet, but I spoke to Gene Vogel, from Sid’s company. The only deal that he knew about was one that hasn’t been officially announced yet. Apparently Sid was going to sell 49% of his company to an equity firm.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Could that be the deal Sid was talking about.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Doesn’t look like it. The terms of the sale would have been set weeks ago. There’s nothing left to negotiate.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey guys … you’re going to want to see this.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So Sid paid for his Metro card in cash. But I was able to use security cams to track him all the way to Grand Army Plaza subway station. He got off there at 11:30PM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: In Brooklyn? What was he doing in Brooklyn?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, I wondered the same thing. So I checked with the 87th precinct. Apparently they responded to a 911 call in that area.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, check it out. Officers used traffic cam footage and they caught the tail end of it. This is about a block away from where Sid got off the subway. Now keep your eye on that alley right there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Were those gunshots?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Fits with the 911 call. It was a report of shots fired. Now, watch what happens next.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Sid. You guys, look at the time stamp. It’s from just after midnight.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This must be the deal he was talking about. And judging by the speed his 60 year old legs are moving I’d say he was in danger.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who’s that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I don’t know. But he’s got a gun. And he’s wearing a mask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And hours later Sid gets thrown down an elevator shaft. What the hell was Sid mixed up in?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, is it just me or does none of this make sense? I mean, Sid was a multimillionaire. Guys like that don’t make shady deals in the middle of dark alleys.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Or if you do, you have someone else do it for you.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, and take a look at our suspect there. I mean, is this a deal gone wrong or a failed hit?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So, uh, what are we saying here? That the masked man followed Sid back to the SNT building and killed him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, with a private entrance with no surveillance cameras it’s possible, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But after an apparent attempt on his life, why would Sid just go back to the office?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And if Sid really was in danger why didn’t he call security?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we may find some answers in that alley.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go check it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, Castle and I are going to scrub traffic cams. Maybe we’ll find the shooter there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Anything yet?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. No blood, no shell casings, no nothing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, doesn’t this remind you of that sketch from Saturday Night Tonight where um … Mickey Franks plays Sherlock Holmes’s wacky cousin?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. I don’t watch that stupid show, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You don’t?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. Hell no. The sketches never have any endings. It’s a big waste of time, just like searching this alley is.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You know, Javi, I think you need to find a way to be more positive.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No. I don’t.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And you need to stop saying “no” all the time. Instead, why don’t you trying saying “yes, and”.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the hell are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I learned it in an SNT sponsored improvisation class I took in college. See, by simply substituting “no” with “yes, and” partners can’t deny one another’s progress, moving forward in a scene and accomplishing goals.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. That guy might have been here last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, and he might have seen the exchange between Sid and the gunman. See what you can accomplish by saying “yes, and”? Hmm?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, and you need to shut the hell up. Hey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Martha, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Oh, yeah. Yeah. Just a little tired, that’s all.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ready to head out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Something’s wrong with your mom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I thought we already covered that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, no, no. She’s not repeating the line. Something else is going on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can’t we just be happy that she stopped?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, I have to go to the precinct. Can you just talk to her and meet me over there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Bye. Bye, Martha!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Bye, honey.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So. Previews tonight. Pretty exciting, huh? Come on. "Is he dead?"

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Wrong question. Am I dead?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: You know, I don’t know what I’m thinking. Eight performances a week, major play, on Broadway.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’ve been on Broadway before.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, well – not since the Clinton administration. And now it’s all viral. Bloggers, tweeters. You know, people actually come to the previews, record the show on their phone, put it online, and make comments.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And you don’t feel your performance is ready?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, I just – I’m still honing my performance. That’s what previews are for. And I just … … I just don’t want to be humiliated. When I got this part I thought, well, hey. There’s a chance, you know? This could be my second act.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It is.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: No it isn’t! It isn’t. I’m not going to have a second act. I – – I think what I need to do is just drop out, let my understudy take over. She is very -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, absolutely not! You will not. And do you know why? Because you’re a fighter. What have you always told me? No one will give you anything in this life. You must earn it. And look at you. Almost twenty years later and you are back on Broadway? You have earned this.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I have. Haven’t I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have. Please don’t let some idiot with a cell phone take that away from you. You want me to come to tonight’s show? Just for moral support?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: I want you to come to the opening, kiddo. Just like you always do.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right. But if I have to wait, at least let me hear that sweet first line one more time.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay. Um … is he dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: But with feeling.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One more for the cheap seats!

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Is he dead?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s so dead!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And bow.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey. So what’d you guys get from the homeless man?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, he didn’t witness the exchange between Sid and our masked gunman. However he did hear the gunshots, and a few minutes later he saw a black Explorer speeding away.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he get a plate?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, the last four numbers, which got us a match to an SUV rented by this guy. Kurt Van Zant. Just did a thirty five year stretch in Folsom for drug trafficking but he was just released.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is there a connection between Sid and this ex-con?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh yeah. While he was in prison Van Zant filed a lawsuit claiming that he financed the pilot for Saturday Night Tonight and that Sid screwed him out of all the profits.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you’re telling me that a drug kingpin bankrolled that comedy show?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. It sounds like one of their comedy sketches, right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So a show that brought joy, laughter, and Judge Booty to people everywhere may have been built on drug money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, but the lawsuit was thrown out. So while Sid was getting rich, Van Zant was rotting in prison.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, maybe Van Zant was who Sid was talking about when he told his wife someone was after him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Makes sense. Right. Van Zant felt that Sid owed him a fair share of profits from the show. Maybe he came to collect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when Sid didn’t want to go along, Van Zant opted for revenge instead. Where is Van Zant now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s registered at a hotel up in Queens.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. I sent Van Zant’s photo to security at SNT, asked if anybody saw him last night. No one did. However, thirty minutes ago Van Zant entered the building on a day pass called in from someone at the show.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Kurt Van Zant? You’ve got to be kidding me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Do you know him?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: No, but Sid told me all about him. He’s dangerous. You’re telling me he’s here in the studio?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you know who called in his pass?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: No. But I can find out. Follow me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um … can I help you?

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Oh, no. It’s fine. You just have a very bizarre gait.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m – I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: I’m sorry, what?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, please tell me I don’t move like that. … I mean, do I?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is this a trick question? What answer is not going to have me sleeping on the couch tonight?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Chad. Find out who called in a day pass for a Kurt Van Zant.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: You’re looking at him, sir.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Wait a minute, you called in the pass? Why?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: I was told to. By Mr. Valentine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Danny Valentine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Danny Valentine.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh ho ho. I knew it. That smug, no talent playboy is up to his neck in this.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! Help! Help! He’s going to kill me! Hey!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Help!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let him go!

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: What? No!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Pull him in, Van Zant. Now!

utterance.speaker: KURT VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Hey lady. Relax.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on. Let me see your hands.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Thanks. The guy’s a psychopath.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Then why did you give him a pass to get on?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: He left a note at my hotel. He said he had information about Sid’s murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re saying you don’t know this man?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: I’ve never met him before today.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Listen, this thing is a big misunderstanding.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m sure it is. Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what information did he have about Sid’s murder.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Nothing. This was a shake down. He claims Sid owed him money for Saturday Night Tonight but since Sid didn’t pay he wanted me to sign over my shares of the show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You own a piece of the show?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Five percent. Sid needed a – a celebrity guest for the pilot so he gave me a piece of the backend. It was the best deal of my life.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Van Zant wanted his cut, but with Sid dead, his only option was to come after yours.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: I refused. I said hey, that’s show business, baby. But that’s when he started shoving me out the window.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thirty five years in Folsom. That’s a long time to hold a grudge, Mr. Van Zant.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Lady, I didn’t kill Sid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And yet you were seen fleeing the alley where those shots were fired. It’s not hard to imagine that you would follow Sid and finish off the job.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Look. You got this all wrong. When I got paroled I went straight to Sid. We had it out and he apologized.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Except now he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Why would I move on him? He agreed to give me a major chunk of change of an upcoming sale of shares to some equity group. So we were good.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That doesn’t square with you shooting at him in the alley.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: That wasn’t me, I swear!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: If it wasn’t you, then who was it?

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: I don’t know. Sid called me and told me the paperwork for my stake in the show was ready. But he wouldn’t sign off unless I brought him something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, fine. I’ll play along. What did Sid want you to bring?

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: An unregistered gun.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why would Sid want a gun? Oh wait, no. Let me guess. He didn’t tell you.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: It’s true! He just told me to meet him near that alley, so I did. I gave him a .38 special and he told me I could pick up the signed papers in the morning. And then he told me I should take a hike.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you didn’t.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Well, a man asks for a gun he’s looking to dance with danger. I thought it wise to protect my investment.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So you’re saying you stuck around just to see what would happen.

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Yep. Saw Sid go down the alley and hide in a doorway. Twenty minutes go by and some dude in a mask shows up, opens the dumpster, pulls out a green duffel bag.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was in the duffel bag?

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Hell if I know. But that’s when Sid jumps out with a gun screaming, “You got what you wanted, now where is she!”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who is "she"?

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: I have no idea. But the masked man got the drop on Sid. They wrestled for the gun, and then, pop, pop, pop! Shots go off in the air.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know what? If you were protecting your investment then why didn’t you help him out?

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: Well, Sid ran off. And the guy in the mask wasn’t giving chase so I figured I’m on parole, I need to bug out before the cops show up.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And that’s all you did?

utterance.speaker: VAN ZANT
utterance.content: I drove to Sid’s building to see if I could catch him and ask him what the hell he got me into. But he never showed up. Next thing I know he’s dead.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think he’s telling the truth. Security video outside of Sid’s apartment shows Van Zant waiting out front, in his car, from 12:30AM to 3:30 in the morning.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s on the other side of town from the studio.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah. Van Zant couldn’t have done it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, that dumpster that you searched? There was no duffel bag?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The guy in the mask must have taken it, which means that Sid must have been the guy who dropped it off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This has to be the deal that Sid was talking about. That duffel bag was the payoff.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. It sure was. I spoke with the business manager. He just discovered that on the day he was murdered Sid made a huge bank withdrawal.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How huge?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Four million dollars in non-sequential bills.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Non-sequential bills? You guys, this was a ransom gone wrong. That’s why Sid asked “where is she”. Some woman in his life was kidnapped.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but who?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s what we’ve gotta find out. Because whoever took her might be our killer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The cast and the crew of Saturday Night Tonight are all at the studio. No one is missing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So we’ve covered Sid’s wife, his family, his friends, and now his job. Everyone’s accounted for.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh … actually not everyone. Evelyn Ross, Sid’s first wife.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She’s missing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I followed up with Sid’s son. And he said she hadn’t returned any of his phone calls. So I spoke with her doorman. He said Evelyn went on her usual 6AM run two days ago and he hasn’t seen her since. She’s gotta be our kidnap victim.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yes, and I was able to ping her cell phone.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes, and.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I wasn’t doing that.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, you did it. Just now.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Anyway, uniforms found the phone dumped in a trashcan near a bodega in the Bronx. Probably tossed there by the kidnapper.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Something’s not right here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Starting with our victim’s behavior. You’re Sid. Your ex-wife gets kidnapped. The deal in the alley to get her back goes south. At that point, why wouldn’t you go to the police? Why do you go back to your office?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, I’ll circle back with Sid’s office, see what I can find out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Unis just arrived with Evelyn’s phone.

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: This is Evelyn’s cloud account. It’s synced to her cell phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Map My Jog. That’s a fitness app. Can you click on it?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It looks like it’s been running this whole time.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’ve seen this app before. They use GPS to calculate a jogger’s distance and pace and, most importantly, their route.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Can you replay Evelyn’s last path?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That’s her leaving her building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, so she jogged to the park.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Wait, is this when she got kidnapped?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s gotta be. She’s moving at thirty miles an hour.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: She had to have been in a vehicle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. Can you fast forward so that we can see where she ended up?

utterance.speaker: TECH
utterance.content: So she was taken up to the Bronx.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Okay, looks like she stopped at this building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Evelyn might still be in that building.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What do we know about that place?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I don’t know. We’ll find out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Hey Ryan, you find anything in Sid’s office?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Nah, just paperwork and spreadsheets.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So nothing that speaks to a possible kidnapping?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Pretty straightforward stuff, but I’ll bring it in so we can go through it with a fine-tooth comb.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett, we got something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. Ryan, I gotta go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: That building where Evelyn was taken is an abandoned warehouse. It’s the ideal location to hold someone hostage.

utterance.speaker: SWAT TEAM MEMBER
utterance.content: NYPD! Go, go, go.

utterance.speaker: SWAT TEAM MEMBER
utterance.content: There. Over there.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Over here! Kick it.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Evelyn? We’re the police. You’re safe now.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN ROSS
utterance.content: Oh God.

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: I had just stopped to stretch and the next thing I knew there was a rag over my mouth and … uh, when I came to I was in that warehouse.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: At any point in time did you look at your kidnapper’s face?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: He always wore a mask. It was like a ski mask, but shiny. With a silver zigzag up the middle and a gold headband.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A gold headband? Are you sure about that?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: I’m pretty sure that’s what it was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And uh, how about his clothes? Do you remember anything distinctive about them?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: No. But he wore a ring. A red and silver signet ring on his right hand. I remember that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Evelyn, back to the mask. Did it look anything like this?

utterance.speaker: EVELYN
utterance.content: Yes. Exactly like that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Is that from Saturday Night Tonight?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s from an obscure sketch they did two years ago called “Lucha Libre Lunch Buffet”.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So our kidnapper had access to the props and wardrobe room at the studio.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This was an inside job.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Carly! Carly Rae Jepsen! I’m Rick – I’m Rick. This is Kate. We’re huge fans.

utterance.speaker: CARLY RAE JEPSEN
utterance.content: Oh, thanks! That means a lot to me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So nice to meet you. Um, Castle, we really need to –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. Um, Carly, quick question. That one song, um, "Call Me Maybe", what did you mean by the lyric “it’s –“

utterance.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
utterance.content: Carly? Two minutes.

utterance.speaker: CARLY RAE JEPSEN
utterance.content: Oh, I’m so sorry. I have to go perform the song.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, that’s cool. We’ve gotta go solve a murder, so…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice to meet you!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Excuse me. Someone recently checked out one of these masks and we need to know who.

utterance.speaker: PROPMASTER
utterance.content: Now? We’re in the middle of a live show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was from the “Lucha Libra Lunch Buffet” sketch.

utterance.speaker: PROPMASTER
utterance.content: Yeah, that sketch sucked. We haven’t used those masks in years.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, is there a record of someone signing it out?

utterance.speaker: PROPMASTER
utterance.content: Probably not, but I can check. Can you give me, like, five minutes?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay. We’ll be back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We are so close.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but who would be so brazen or so naïve as to use a mask from the show to perpetrate a kidnapping?

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Ladies and gentlemen, performing her hit single “I Really Like You”, Carly Rae Jepsen!

utterance.speaker: CARLY RAE JEPSEN
utterance.content: This is for you, Sid.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Nice moves. You guys want a better seat? There’s nothing like watching the show from house seats.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Hey. It’s cool. You can stay here if you like.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beckett, check out his ring.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just like Evelyn described. Hey Chad? We’ve got a house seat for you. Down at the twelfth precinct. Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, Chad, tell us. How long have you been a page with SNT?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Uh, five incredible years. Why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don’t most pages quit if they don’t get promoted after a year or two?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Oh, for me it’s worth the wait. Any day now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, sorry. I don’t buy it. I think you got tired of waiting and after so many years you wanted payback.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Payback? What do you mean, payback?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m talking about the four million dollar kind. You kidnapped Sid’s ex-wife.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Wait, what?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It was a pretty clever plan. All except that one tiny detail you could not have foreseen: Sid confronting you at the money drop. He recognized your ring, didn’t he? That was when you realized your only way out was to kill him.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: You think I killed Mr. Ross?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can drop the act. We know what you did. Even Evelyn saw your ring.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: My ring? No, no. I bought this ring at the SNT gift shop. Lots of people have it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, except lots of people don’t have evidence in their apartments.

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: What are you talking about? I didn’t do anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then why don’t you explain how detectives found a .38 revolver and a Lucha Libre mask under your bed?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: Um … must have been an evil tooth fairy that put it there, because it wasn’t me. Please, I – I – I didn’t do this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, then where were you the night that Sid was murdered?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: At home.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Can anyone verify that?

utterance.speaker: CHAD
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: VALENTINE
utterance.content: Sid was a tough SOB, but he loved his job and his job was to get us to make America laugh. And tonight we honor him by doing just that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chad can’t be the killer, can he?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, it doesn’t feel right, but there is an abundance of evidence.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, it’s too abundant. The mask, the gun, the ring? It’s just too perfect.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So, what? You think he was framed?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think there’s more to this story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, it’s possible the killer wanted Evelyn to see the mask and the ring.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Chad is the perfect fall guy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, but it Chad didn’t do it then who did?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, I may have a line on that. I figured out what Sid was doing in his office with those spreadsheets. He was going over his corporate bank accounts.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sid went from paying a kidnapper at gunpoint to checking his corporate financials? That’s … weird.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s not the only thing that’s weird. Check out those expenses he highlighted.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, these are weird. Because …

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Because. I called the bank in the Cayman Islands. All of those expenses are bogus.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So someone with access at Sid’s company was embezzling money.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Almost four million dollars, the exact amount of the ransom.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wait. That’s it. The embezzler was trying to replace the money he’d stolen from Sid.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I know who the killer is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know who the killer is. Nice. In fairness though, I walked you right through that.

utterance.speaker: STAGE MANAGER
utterance.content: Places for the final sketch. Places for the final sketch.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: Oh, hi. Is everything all right?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes. In fact, we have some good news.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Great. Let’s talk after the show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, the show’s already over. At least for you.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Drop the act, Mr. Vogel. We know that you killed Sid.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: That’s insane.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not really. Not considering the partial sale of Sid’s company was on the horizon. A sale that would mean a review of the company’s books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Which would expose the four million dollars that you embezzled.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: What? Are you out of your mind?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, but you must have been. Faced with the inevitability of being caught, you had to do something. So you kidnapped and ransomed Evelyn in order to reimburse the money you’d stolen.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A duffel bag full of cash would be easy to deposit in the company’s Cayman Island bank, where no questions are asked.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: After that, all you’d have to do is falsify a few bank statements and you’d be in the clear.

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: How dare you? This is absurd.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We followed the money, Gene. You siphoned four million dollars to invest in a startup company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And when that company went belly up you could not get your money back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sid must have recognized you at the drop but he didn’t confront you until after he discovered the faked expenses.

utterance.speaker: LIZ
utterance.content: So you killed him? Gene, how could you?

utterance.speaker: VOGEL
utterance.content: No. These are – these are baseless accusations. They can’t prove anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, we can. We went through your financials and found millions in undeclared deposits from Sid’s company.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, by the way. Nice touch wearing the mask and SNT ring that Chad has. Only problem with your frame job? You were witnessed hanging outside his apartment this afternoon when you planted them. Oops.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gene Vogel, you’re under arrest for –

utterance.speaker: TINA
utterance.content: Model cop down! I broke a heel –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gene Vogel, you are under arrest for kidnapping and murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett, that was a badass takedown tonight on that show. It was strong yet … sexy.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, Beckett. The camera really loves you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You guys, shut up, both of you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about me, guys? How did I look?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Like you should stick to writing.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, I think so. There’s only one star in this family, kiddo.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mother. How was your preview performance?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well … check out the, uh, the twitterverse, as they say.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All righty … "Martha Rodgers is a revelation. Martha Rodgers gives a masterful performance. A display of why theater is still a relevant art form. Martha Rodgers is amazeballs."

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Yeah, about that. Is that "amazeballs" a good thing, because –

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It sure is. Congratulations. Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Okay. Oh, great. Then we can celebrate! I brought some champagne for everybody – – if you will open it. Do we have some glasses?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, we don’t do a lot of entertaining here, Martha, but ta-da.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Ah. That’ll work. Thank you, thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Perfect. Thank you, Detective Ryan. To my amazeballs mother, the best second act on Broadway.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cheers.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Cheers.
